definition: to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely

sentences.english: He contrived to get himself disliked.
sentences.chinese: 他費盡心思反而於自己惹人討厭。

sentences.english: Tabloid gossip derives its entertainment value from subtle suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 八卦小報費盡心思，企圖從細枝末節中發現文娛價值。

sentences.english: The white house is on enjoying, really fee to devote to think.
sentences.chinese: 白家在享受上頭，真是費盡心思。

sentences.english: If they set their mind to it they are most likely to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們費盡心思去做了，那他們很有可能成功。

sentences.english: Chen Junlang goes all out thinking of ways to hold these kids' attention.
sentences.chinese: 陳俊朗費盡心思引發孩子的興趣。
我們爲取名字而費盡心思。

sentences.english: He began to trouble concerning the extradition laws.
sentences.chinese: 他開始費盡心思地去想關於引渡法的問題。

definition: to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to force someone to do something
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
to gain nothing/to end up empty-handed
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
(abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
